intro: Manihot cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf arrowleaf, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain toxic seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and medicinal studies.
